Cleanliness is the main key in the processing of medicinal plants because it will affect the quality of the herbs produced. 
Personal Hygiene 
Healthy condition 
Get in the habit of washing your hands with soap before and after making herbal medicine. 
Use clean clothes 
Using headgear, apron, gloves and wearing a mask (for those who have the flu). 
Fingernails are short and clean 
Do not use hand jewelry (nail, rings, etc.) 
Do not smoke, spit, eat and drink while in the process of making herbal medicine.


Equipment Hygiene 
Wash the equipment to be used with soap, rinse with running water, then dry and store in a special place that has been provided. 
Prepare equipment for making herbal medicine before carrying out the manufacturing process. 
Do not wash utensils that will be used in the toilet. 
Before using the bottle, the bottle must be cleaned first, here's how to wash/clean the bottle 
Wash the bottle and bottle cap until clean then brush with soap until clean and rinse using running water to make it cleaner. 
Boil the bottle and cap in the water until it boils for 15 minutes. 
Drain and dry the bottle and bottle cap to dry. 
Store bottles and caps in a special place provided.


Environmental Hygiene/ Sanitation 
A good environment or recommended in making herbal medicine is as follows. 
A clean environment, free from animals and free from environmental pollution areas, as well as equipment storage areas in a clean condition. 
Putting a closed trash can 
The place of manufacture is not close to latrines or toilets. 
Perform routine site cleaning.
